During his reign the Serbian capital was moved to [[Smederevo]] (near Belgrade) after the [[Battle of Kosovo (1448)|Second Battle of Kosovo]].
During his reign the Serbian capital was moved to [[Smederevo]] (near Belgrade) after the [[Battle of Kosovo (1448)|Second Battle of Kosovo]].
After he was appointed as a successor for his uncle, Despot [[Stefan LazareviÄ]], BrankoviÄ's rule was marked by new conflicts and the fall of [[Kosovo|Kosovo and Metohia]] to the [[Ottoman Empire]]. BrankoviÄ allied himself with the [[Kingdom of Hungary]]. In 1439 the Ottomans captured [[Smederevo]], the BrankoviÄ's capital. The prince fled to the Kingdom of Hungary where he had large estates, which included [[Zemun]], [[Stari Slankamen|Slankamen]], [[Kupinovo|Kupinik]], [[Sremska Mitrovica|Mitrovica]], [[BeÄej|Stari BeÄej]], [[Kulpin, Serbia|Kulpin]], [[Äurug]], [[Sveti Petar]], [[Perlek]], [[Peser]], [[BaÄko Petrovo Selo|Petrovo Selo]], [[Novi BeÄej|BeÄej]], [[AraÄ]], [[Zrenjanin|Veliki BeÄkerek]], [[VrÅ¡ac]], etc.
